title: 112_hr3715
content: The "Online Job Training Act of 2011" may be cited as the Act. It includes provisions for online workforce training programs. Section 171 of the Workforce Investment Act of 1998 is amended to include a provision for National Online Workforce Training Grants to eligible entities for distance-learning programs using technologies like the Internet. Grants can be combined with other resources to expand participation in training programs. National Online Workforce Training Grants are available to eligible entities such as educational institutions, community-based organizations, and nonprofits that offer online training programs. Priority is given to entities with experience in online workforce training and coordination with the workforce investment system. Each eligible entity receiving a grant under this program must collect and report data on participants, services received, completion rates, barriers to participation, job placement rates, and more. Each eligible entity receiving a grant under this program must collect data on participants, services, completion rates, barriers, job placement rates, and conduct outreach activities to disseminate information about the program and best practices in workforce training. The Secretary will establish performance indicators for evaluating eligible entities receiving grants. Prior to awarding a grant, performance levels must be agreed upon. $50,000,000 is authorized for fiscal years 2012 through 2022. Additionally, there will be an online training program clearinghouse. The Secretary will award a grant to a postsecondary educational institution to provide online training program clearinghouse services. The institution must demonstrate the ability to disseminate research on best practices for workforce investment programs and be a national leader in technology-related research. The postsecondary educational institution receiving a grant will provide technical assistance, collect and disseminate data, and share best practices related to workforce investment systems. Authorization of appropriations is provided to the Secretary for this purpose. Authorization of $1,000,000 for fiscal years 2012 through 2022 for the Secretary to carry out workforce investment system-related activities.
